intro: Serruria rebeloi, commonly known as the Cape rose or red-flowered serruria, is a striking evergreen shrub native to South Africa. The plant typically grows in coastal fynbos habitats, thriving in well-drained, sandy soils. Its flowers attract pollinators such as birds and insects, contributing to its ecological significance. Serruria rebeloi is often cultivated for its ornamental value and resilience in coastal gardens.
